Reviews.Title: “For a short stay, cost was my primary criteria”
Reviews.Author: ruppbenn_traveling
Reviews.Content: I read the other reviews before I booked this hotel and selected this hotel for reasons I give below. The only good comments I can make are (1) the hotel is nicely located on the far edge of the Jordaan district in a quiet area and (2) the room rate was inexpensive and included a small but adequate breakfast. I would add that our beds were adequate and had warm blankets. Balanced against these are significant issues. The hotel's facilities are out-dated and badly need renovations. Although I detected no unpleasant odors, the hotel's general appearance suffers from neglect. The bathroom sink and shower were rusted and leaky. The carpeting was frayed. The room was small and contained the bare minimum... beds, table, chair, television, and telephone. The staff person at the desk was indifferent and offered very little information beyond the location of the room. The hotel lacks an elevator and has steep steps (as in most Amsterdam small hotels), with some rooms on the fifth level. There is a breakfast room but no other public area for relaxation. In short, if you have a short stay and price and convenience of location are your primary considerations, you might consider this hotel. On the other hand, if comfort and ambience are important to you, I could not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Emmita_1
Reviews.Content: I absolutely recommend the Acacia hotel. We stayed there at the end of April 2011 and were very pleased. Staff was friendly, breakfast good and rooms clean and comfortable. There was a nice view to the canal. Location was also good, Jordaan is not too far away from the city centre but very beautiful area and nicely calm and peaceful. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have been in.”
Reviews.Author: simon_densham
Reviews.Content: Looked at this website, saw some good reviews and thus booked for 4 nights. We got there at ten in the evening to find a S**T hole. The room smells of urine, there are hairs in the bed, snot wiped on to the wall. The room was 2m by 3m if we were lucky. The next morning we left after having a disscusion with the manger. we went to a different hotel. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL, I REPEAT TO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “No value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_Balzarelli
Reviews.Content: Booking was made via booking.com 3 months ahead for a double room with two beds. At arrival a room was booked on the 5th floor with no elevator. No other rooms were available. Service did not want to help bringing bagage to the 5th floor; while guest was my father of 70 years. Ridiculous! During the night, receptionist did not want to open the door and breakfast is not served if you are 1 minute later than 10:00. Basically, service was rude and not willingly to help at all! The room itself had 2 beds with matresses which did not offer anymore support. Basically you slept on the floor. Furthermore beds were broken and the supporting wheel broke off. Multiple hairs of other people were found on the walls. The rooms were extremely small; toilet door cannot close while you're on it. Shower was dirty. However the location is nice, at the outer rings of the Jordaan. So nice and quit. But the rest of the hotel is just terrible. So either you spend less and go to a hostel and have the same service and rooms. Or you go to a higher quality hotel and enjoy a proper hotel. NO RECOMMENDATION!

Reviews.Title: “Ok so the truth is...Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Kanakatraveler
Reviews.Content: The Joordan area is awesome, The hotel is lovely and totally simple. Its pretty clean, the staff is nice and the breakfast is excellent....The best part...NO TOURISTS. its a neighborhood of mostly dutch residents that just work and live in the area but its a 15 minute walk to mostly everywhere. I will definitely be back and I think that the value and location of the Acacia Hotel totally outweighs its simplicity. Its cute, fun, and the Saturday market right outside was AWESOME. So for all of those that need room service and marble showers,,,go to the hyatt...for real travelers..Go to the Acacia Hotel. Really..its fine. One thing...The stairs are crazy steep but look around your in Holland..everything was built in the 1600's The stairs are steep in every home and hotel in the joordan. P.S. Go to Zaans Shaans..Google it.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite”
Reviews.Author: DeniseReaves
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so cute, comfortable and the staff is wonderful. The rooms are small and bare but clean and comfortable. It is located in the Jordaan area (safe and quiet) and on Sat there is a market on the street below. There is a great little bar across the street and within walking distance there are many good eats. Just a few blocks away is Anne Frank House, and many many great sites. Amsterdam is full of wonderful people, culture and food. It's a don't miss!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jorgeandariego
Reviews.Content: The bathroom terribly stinks; I had never taken a shower before wearing socks. So disgusting was the room. Furthermore, the staff is very unfriendly. At the time we had to pick our lugagge to get our train no personnel was in the hotel and the door was locked. After calling to the phone number the reception guy appeared 10 min later with the explanation that he had gotten to go to the police because someone broke in... We just went without saying a word to just get our train.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ClarisTexas
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at Hotel Acacia and would recommend it as a great place to stay if you are on a budget. The rooms are a good size, very clean, lots of light from large windows, nice bathroom and comfy bed. The location of the hotel is fantastic, very close to the main train station, easy walk to Anne Frank's house, lots of nice restaurants and cafes and also very handy to a bike hire shop. Would highly reccomend the Mexican resturant right outside! I also found that staff to be very friendly and helpful. Were happy to store my bag for a few hours after I checked out and they a laptop avail to all guests to access the net for free, plus free printing.

Reviews.Title: “Needs more than a lick of paint”
Reviews.Author: JungleFaceJake
Reviews.Content: This place is interesting. It is in a lovely location, albeit maybe a little out of the way. It has a nice review in Lonely Planet, (2008) So you would maybe think it would try to work with these things instead of rest on them. Unfortunately it has rested on them and sunk very deep into the bad side. I really wanted to like this place, the location is lovely and the shape of the hotel is quirky and quite interesting. Even the steep stairs didn't bother me as they are pretty much standard in all of Holland. The miserable, almost Auto-Pilot reception and being given a key and pointed to the stairs, wasn't the nicest welcome. The room was hot, and pretty battered, really needing a spruce up. The beds where so stupidly soft it was like sleeping on a blancmange. And the bathroom was horrible and in need of some care. The breakfast was ok, though and the place does have a nice feel to it at breakfast, but the rest really needs updating. Oh and when I woke up on the final day I realised that there where no towels in our room. By that time I just wanted to get out so we just paid (Not by debit card as they don't accept them?) and left. I Will go back to Amsterdam I Will definitely go back to Jordaan. I WILL NOT go back to Hotel Acacia. In summary it is a really big missed opportunity that has lots of potential but has maybe run out of steam. You can get a lot more for not much more money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: MrXSweden
Reviews.Content: Don't go to this hotel! We stayed in a room at the top floor. The stairs were terrible and the interior in the room was ugly, especially the bathroom. We left the room early in the mornings and came back as late as possible in the evenings, because we didn't want to spend any time there. In the breakfast room, the roof was dripping. So if you wait a few years, you might at least find a swimming pool at this hotel! We had booked three nights at the hotel, but we moved out after two nights. We just couldn't stand it! /Stockholm, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: lexibakes
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Acacia last week, June 24-27 2009. I wish I coud give a better review, but we were not impressed. The major problem was that our bathroom smelled like urine and mold, even after it was cleaned by the staff each morning. Unfortunately, that smell came into the bedroom as well. The bathroom was also uncomfortably small; the shower is so tight that we found it almost impossible to shave our legs. The light fixture in our room was missing its cover, the room needed to be repainted because of scuffmarks and dead bug smears on the walls. There was the base of an old phone that was still attached to the wall. There is next to no storage in our room, only a very small closet, but no drawers. We had to use the tiny table and chairs. Also troubling was the fact that my sister kept getting bitten by something in the room. The street is lovely and the hotel has tremendous potential if the owners would take the time to put in some work and make it clean and modern. Right now, I would steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: hegeanett
Reviews.Content: We rented a studio in Hotel Acacia for five nights. The studio was on ground level, so every morning we could bring our chairs outside to have coffee by the canal. The room is simple, a bit worn down with out dated colours etc, but very clean. Ok breakfast in a cosy breakfast room. Quiet neighbourhood with nice people and beautiful surroundings. Pleasant and helpfull staff. We where alltogether very happy, but we missed two things. The shower was not working 100 %, and we missed a whole-figure mirror in the room (to ladies travelling need mirrors). Other than that, we where happy, and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Forgo the Dumpy Houseboat”
Reviews.Author: macoball
Reviews.Content: On the outside, Acacia Hotel looks like your typical, charming, family-run European hotel, but step into the hotel's one of two houseboats and you'll be in for a major disappointment. I had originally opted for the houseboat rental because the website pictured a cozy-looking, clean and private houseboat. There was even a kitchenette and "central heating". Much to our dismay, the houseboat we had smelled moldy and looked like its pea green linoleum floors and walls hadn't been washed in eons. What was suppose to be a romantic bedroom consisted of two small twin beds pushed together so that you had a nice piece of 2x4 running down the middle. The pillows were not pillows, but seemingly lumpy sacks of potatoes. When I complained to the very serious and not particularily friendly receptionist that our houseboat looks nothing like the pictures advertised in the internet, he merely asserted "that is not your room". (Made me wonder whether the rooms shown on Acacia Hotel's website were from an imaginary place altogether!) I asked to change to a regular room and he offered a double room on the 3rd floor. Keep in mind that the spiral staircase leading to the 3rd floor is about 2 ft wide and extremely steep. Since the hotel has a 48hr cancellation policy and there was no way we'd be able to get our luggage up to that room, we were stuck in the dumpy houseboat.

Reviews.Title: “Houseboat was OK, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: enceladus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the modern houseboat during our 3 night stay in August. The houseboat is very spacious. There is a mini kitchen. There are sliding glass doors that open up on to the small canal. Not many boats go by, it's mainly really cute ducks swimming by. I thought it would be a bit more posh but it was pretty utilitarian but still reasonable for the price. Neither one of us liked the bed (two twins pushed together) or pillows. They definitely need to be replaced. I think they are extremely old and worn out. My husband is convinced the pillows made him sick and he refused to use them after the fist night (he has no history of refusing pillows!). Anyway, if there was a new bed and pillows I think we would have had a better experience. The neighborhood is extremely charming. The breakfast provided is excellent and the breakfast room is very cute. I'd say this place is a good value just bring your own pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean And Near The City Center”
Reviews.Author: THE_COLE
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel in april and stayed there for 4 nights.... I was with my girlfriend and it was a very pleasant staying I have to say! I booked the hotel calling them from Italy and It was very simple: booked the room, made a bank transfer and then they confirmed the room. Whe booked the MODERN HOUSEBOAT because we wanted a kitchen to make meals on our own...we never had breakfast because we used to wake up very late in the morning..(breakfast is available tioll 9,30!!) The room, which was a little apartment in fact, was vey clean and tidy: no moquette (yeah!!!), a TV, small kichen, a table and chairs...very tidy! Service people were very kind and they also washed us the dishes!!!! They used to come while we were sleeping and I always asked them to come later and they always came later!! wondewrful ( I like to sleep till late in the morning when I'm on holiday) People from the reception were very kind and when we arrived they gave us a map and some tips for our first days in amsterdam.. This hotel is quite near to the city center: the day bus stop is a 2 minutes walk far from the hotel and the night bus stop it's 6 minutes far. The neighbourhood is very quite and in the night looks safe... HAd a very nice staying there! Cheap and comfortable, what else????

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Squishington
Reviews.Content: After being told we MUST stay in their houseboats from a previous guest, I have to say we were disappointed. The modern houseboat we were in was not really a houseboat in my eyes; it was simply a building built on top of a floating concrete pier. I would rather have saved the 15 Euro a night and stayed in the hotel proper; the only reason I would stay in the houseboat would be for its kitchenette, which came with crockery and cutlery â€“ might save you an expensive meal out if you decided to eat-in. The room was clean, apart from the food a previous guest had left in the fridge. Three of the lights in the room werenâ€™t working, and although the receptionist didn't come across as being a very friendly person, he did fix two of them for us (after suggesting we might not be using the right switches to make the lights turn on). Breakfast was a few slices of bread (some toasted, some not) and crackers, with spreads, a few slices of cheese and ham, and a hard-boiled egg, with a glass of juice and a cup of tea or coffee. The location was a bit disappointing, being at least 20 minutes walk from just about everything you might want to experience in Amsterdam. Personally, I would find something cheaper and closer to the centre of town/the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotal Acacia!”
Reviews.Author: Princess95
Reviews.Content: After a dreadful experience at the Belle Suite Apartment where we were supposed to have stayed, we had a wonderful time here! The staff at the desk were approachable, friendly and helpful. We knew from looking in the travel books that this hotel was in a cheaper-to- stay bracket, but it was clean & tidy and didn't pretend to be something that it wasn't. All you need in Amsterdam, or anywhere else for that matter, is a base from which to explore. People shouldn't book a holiday to the hotel whatever, they should book it to the place - as in Amsterdam! The Jordaan is a wonderful residential area, so you don't feel too much like a tourist - though it's close to Anne Frank Huis and the Westerkerk for some essential sightseeing. We had a lovely view over the adjacent canal, a brilliant breakfast set us up for the day and there were some great 'coffee-shops' nearby (Barney's) to chill-out in. The bed was comfortable and the shower lovely. We had a truly wonderful stay and fully intend to return within the next six months, but this time we hope to book the authentic houseboat! We have recommended the Hotel Acacia to our family and friends.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: A Sydneysider who lives in London
Reviews.Title: “Loved the Acacia”
Reviews.Author: Phurge
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the modern houseboat and had a thoroughly enjoyable time. The Acacia hotel is located in the upscale Jordaan district which is primarily residential. It was great to be in a peaceful and quiet area. Getting into the "tourist central" parts of Amsterdam takes about 5 to 10 minutes on a bike (essential in Amsterdam). The modern houseboat is clean, spacious and comes with a fridge and stove top. No complaints at all. Once we had our keys to the houseboat we didn't need to deal with hotel management at all, but they seemed friendly & competent. The beds were incredibly soft & comfortable, we wanted to sleep in for hours. (only downside is that the double was actually two singles pushed together, with a tendency to drift apart in the night, but this is a minor quibble). We thought the modern house boat was great value for money and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location/Bad management”
Reviews.Author: tutUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the modern house boat or half house boat I should stay....It was basic but clean and quite spacious apart from the bathroom who is more like in a boat! Great quiet location...but...the guy at reception was so rude and not arranging that I will not return nor recommend the place. Hotel is a business in whcih you need to please the customers, have great interpersonel skills and not being a moron!!! Breakfast from 8 to 9.30am is a bit inconvenient either if you are there on business with an early start or on a holiday when you want to take it easy

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Quiet, but a distance to walk”
Reviews.Author: USALoveTraveling
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter. The room was comfortable, clean and (by local standards) roomy. It also was very quiet! (The last time we stayed near the train station - it was so noisy that it was difficult to sleep at night). We slept very well both nights. The desk was fairly helpful, and the breakfast good. We were on the third floor. The stairs are the typical, VERY steep steps one would expect in Amsterdam. If you aren't prepared, this would be a shock. People who have difficulty climbing stairs should go to a hotel with a reliable lift. This hotel would not be a good choice. On the less positive notes - it is a good walk from the downtown and we didn't figure out a easy way to get public transportation to the location. This was a problem because we were in Amsterdam for only two days and didn't want to spend so much time walking back and forth from the hotel. But, we did get away from the sound a traffic and large crowds. Also, we checked out before 7AM the second morning - before breakfast was served. We had to argue with them for them to fix us a sack breakfast. The sacks they prepared were wonderful. But, we had to be very assertive to get them.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: EGM77
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Don't expect anything fancy. The stairs are very steep so be prepared. The rooms are small and strangely shaped. But the beds are comfortable and the breakfast is good. Since you don't go to Amsterdam to lounge in a hotel this place is really all you need, the price is right and your in a unique old building,in a good location. There is also a market in the street nearby at certain times, although we missed it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DIGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although pictures on web-site did not match-up with what our accomodations truly were...our stay on the authentic houseboat was marvelous. Clean, clean, clean and every night after a long day out, it was nice to come back to something we considered "home" for 7 days. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was delicious and served quickly. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Studio apt is a pit”
Reviews.Author: gbb4U
Reviews.Content: The Studio is on the ground floor allowing street traffic to peer in day and night. The only way to prevent this is to close the dusty red drapes, allowing no light in. Broken chair, ratty furniture, tiny tiny bathroon and rude staff make this hotel a bad choice. Staff are rude, caustic, and unhelpful. Dreadful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros- Nieghborhood Cons- i'd like to start off by saying ive seen ladders less steep than these stairs. I actually put on my hiking boots and harness before going up them. The kid at the front desk was snobby and rolled his eyes at me. I sorta felt like snapping his neck off. Caution: do not try the white mints in the bowl at the desk, they suck, really bad. I should also warn you that the continental breakfast sucked for the most part, but the orange juice was good and the lady there was nice. Another thing about the breakfast room, it sucks, and it doesnt have enough tables to accomodate everyone in the hotel, which was why some of the people couldnt get it. and now, the room. Incredibly small, and incredibly strangely shaped. Scuff marks all over the wall like someone had ridden up the stairs, came into our room and procedded doing burnouts on the walls with a dirtbike. but this of course, would be impossible becasue the stairs are completly verticle. The bathroom was incredibly small, im going to add that you should look at the plumbing. Also, after you flush, you have to wait about 10 minuites before you can flush again. No, im not exxagerating. We were SUPPOSED to get a twin bedroom. They gave us a small double. The TV was fuzzy and sucked. I never stayed in the houseboats, but they looked as if they sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Acacia - Great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: Hampy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Acacia in May 2005. The hotel itself is very quaint. The rooms are adequate yet clean- however the bathroom is quite small. The main attraction is the actual neighborhood. The Jordaan is a wonderful, safe neighborhood with tons of wonderful restaurants and shops. Hotel Acacia is walking distance to all of the major sites. The front desk wasn't overly forthcoming with information, but overall, I would recommend staying at this hotel. Oh - the stairs really are incredibly steep - so be prepared!

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuropeFan
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must strongly recommend that anyone who wants a less tourist-y, more Dutch experience stay in the Jordaan district. We absolutely loved it and if you rent a bike, which I also STRONGLY recommend, you're only 5 minutes from the center of the city. As far as the Acacia Hotel, well, it was was pretty good. It is absolutely true that the steps are verrrrrrrrrrry steep (see the photo - although it doesn't really do the steepness of the stairs justice). Anyone not entirely able-bodied is sure to have a problem. Our room, our beds, and the bathroom facilities were all just average, although the breakfast was quite filling (make sure you ask for an egg or you won't get one). I really rate the hotel as above average because of its location, which we really couldn't have been happier with. At the end of the day it was so nice to get away from the overwhelming crowds in the city center and return to our very quiet, very Dutch neighborhood. If you stay in the Jordaan and do plan to rent a bike, check out City Bike just a few blocks away from Hotel Acacia. The front desk can give you a brochure.

Reviews.Title: “Past Its Prime”
Reviews.Author: Offseason
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Acacia in May. We planned to spend six nights in their houseboat but had to spend the first night in the hotel as the boat was booked. The hotel room was on the third floor. First, the staircase was steeper than some ladders I have used. Very tough to lug luggage up the ladder to our room. The room itself was smaller than most office cubicles. The lumpy bed was tucked into a space so tight you could only access it on one side. Think RV type space. Very tough for two people to share. The bathroom was small and very worn. Cigarette burns on the sink as well as cracking and peeling counters overall. The TV was fuzzy and all the furniture was very worn. On the second night, we moved to the house boat. The space was not anything like what their website photos show. You actually only get half the boat, not the whole thing. The furniture was worn, the blinds were broken and dirty. One window pane was actually missing. The floor was old linoleum that was not that clean. The kitchenette consisted of two hot plates, a small sink and a very small refrigerator. No oven, no microwave and no supplies at all. The coffee maker was old and dirty. No filters, no sugar, no salt or pepper any basics at all. Lastly, the hot water heater didn't work. We called the manager and he got it working. That brought the water up to a bout 60 degrees. We left for another hotel the next morning and will never go back. The staff was nice and appeared to understand our disappointment but were not in a position to do anything about it. Very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Jensen79
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the modern houseboat. It was very spaceious and clean. A great way to wake up in the morning, looking at the canal. The service was great, always helpfull and full of knowledge. The location is great, once you figure out the tram system. We will return on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “like student accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel Acacia is in a nice area and the staff are nice but if you have the misfortune to stay in the top of the hotel which can be reached by climbing up steep steep staircase after steep steep staircase you are in for a shock. The room was horrible. It was worse than student accomodation that I stayed in in London and that wasn't that nice. Think 70's wall to floor linoleum and lumpy single- small beds. After that climb!! For 65 euro - a single room rate if was a rip off!! To add insult to injury at 10.25 someone came and banged really loudly on my door. I was not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dave.f999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the modern houseboat and friends of ours stayed in the studio apartment and we found this place to be excellent. Very cheap for Amsterdam and even better with good breakfast included. Fab location for us (out of but close to the centre) in the Jordaan area where there are actual Dutch people (as oppose to drunken yobs and frat boys!). Lovely market on the Saturday morning at Lindengracht. Accom itself was spotless, warm and comfy. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable. I could not recommend this place more for a stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the prior review I guess we stayed on the "traditional" houseboat in June (3 nights at 95 euros per night). Very satisfactory digs and a lot of fun--you feel more like a property owner than a hotel guest. The Jordaan is a great part of town--good restaurants and bars without the crowds--and the Acacia seems to attract a nice clentele. The staff, especially young Julian at the front desk, are caring and attentive in ways that you would only expect at much pricier hotels. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, great neighborhood, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: twilight26
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the Acacia overall. Stayed 2-9 June, 2004. I knew ahead of time that the rooms might be pretty small and the stairs were steep, but whoa... they are almost as steep as climbing a ladder so be warned. And the room was a bit drab but I liked the view of the houses and cafe across the street. But all in all, I thought the place was charming, and the location was really great. A little off the beaten path but not too far away from anything interesting. There are many fantastic cafes and restaurants nearby--the Jordaan is a cozy, nice neighborhood. I think next time if I stay there, I'll try booking the houseboat.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Ana_NJ
Reviews.Content: Pros: In the center (not THE Center though), great neighborhood; charming breakfast room; relatively cheap (the $80 price includes breakfast) Cons: Very Steep stairs! (good luck if you have heavy luggage), tiny room (I didn't see them all), sewer smell on the top floor. The view was not very charming either. The widow with a "Canal view" was facing a modern apartment building on the other side of the canal. The other window was facing ugly roof tops with junk on them. We tried to keep the curtains closed. Overall it's not too bad for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acacia, good cheap accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acacia in 2002, its in a pleasant part of the City, walking distance to the centre. Hotel on a corner site overlooking a canal, pleasant breakfast room, extremely steep stairs to rooms, dont even think about it if you have a disability. Basic clean small room in a typical old Amsterdam property with character. Family run with friendly staff. Good locals bar on opposite corner. A good base for a visit to Amsterdam, above average for its price, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the stairs, but enjoy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very impressed w/ the Hotel Acacia. Considering that it only cost $80/ night for a 2 bedroom room w/ private bath, shower & tv. The room was pretty small but that was something I assumed ahead of time. THe beds were very comfortable although frighteningly close together. THe bathroom facilities were fine and the tv was nice because we watched alot of Euro MTv at night/ early morning. Free breakfast every morning is a definite + although I only managed to make it for breakfast once. Just don't expect too much -typical euro breakfast w/ coffee, bread, some meat & cheese. The stirway up to the rooms was scary though. Probably the steepest and narrowest stairway you'll ever see but par for the course in amsterdam. THe staff was very friendly and helpful. Just make sure to pay w/ cash or it's an extra 15% per night. Not a bad walk to the main part of the city either. Overall I give the Hotel Acacia a solid B rating. Can't get a much better deal for your buck.

HotelInfo.Name: Acacia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lindengracht 251, Amsterdam 1015KH, The Netherlands
